intro: Parosela argyraea, commonly known as the silverleaf parosela, is a flowering plant native to parts of southern Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking silver-green foliage. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
